basics.name: Chen Bofan
basics.label: Mathematician and Financial Economist
basics.summary: A highly accomplished mathematician and financial economist with a strong background in mathematics, finance, and engineering. Known for significant contributions in temporal network analysis and robust time series data representation.

work.name: University of Cambridge
work.summary: Conducted research on meta-learning for time series data, proposing the MetaINR method and demonstrating its superior performance in various experiments.
highlights: Developed MetaINR method for implicit neural representation of time series.
Integrated meta-learning into functional data analysis framework.

work.name: Peking University
work.summary: Conducted Bayesian comparison of asset pricing models, applying MCMC methods and analyzing the robustness of various priors.
highlights: Utilized Bayesian statistics to compare asset pricing models.
Applied methodology to Chinese stock market data.

work.name: Freestone Robotics Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Worked on traditional motion detection algorithms and modified SLAM methods for improved robotic performance.
highlights: Modified GMAPPING source code for non-ROS applications.

volunteer.summary: Established a multidisciplinary student team for applying knowledge in engineering practice and promoting cross-disciplinary collaboration.
highlights: Set up the course 'Building Drones from Scratch' with over 100 students enrolled each semester.
Guided 24 students in mechanical design, circuit design, and controller programming.

awards.title: First Prize in Beijing Mathematical Modeling Competition
Third Prize Scholarship of Peking University
First Prize in China Mathematics Competition

publications.name: Temporal local clustering coefficient uncovers the hidden pattern in temporal networks
publications.summary: Proposed a method to quantify clustering in temporal networks, uncovering patterns and revealing intrinsic interaction features in various empirical data sets.

projects.name: Quadruped Robot Design
projects.summary: Designed and prototyped a quadruped robot using 3D printing and Raspberry Pi for motor control, implementing a PID controller for basic gait execution.
